sn21.9:1: At Sāvatthī.sn.ii.282Then the Venerable Tissa, the Blessed One's paternal cousin,[n.395] He was the Buddha’spitucchāputta,son of the Buddha’s paternal aunt, Amitā (DPPN, s.v. Tissa Thera (4)).approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, and sat down to one side—miserable, sorrowful, with tears streaming down. Then the Blessed One said to him:
sn21.9:2: This is what the Blessed One said. Having said this, the Fortunate One, the Teacher, further said this:
sn21.9:3: "Why are you angry? Don’t be angry!Nonanger is better for you, Tissa.It is to remove anger, conceit, and scorn,That the holy life is lived, O Tissa."
